newsitem.title: USA: Chubb up after Q1 beats forecasts.
newsitem.headline: Chubb up after Q1 beats forecasts.

text.p: Shares of Chubb Corp posted strong gains in late morning trading after the company reported first quarter earnings that beat analysts' expectations.
The company reported first quarter operating earnings of $1.00 a share compared with $0.72 a share a year ago. The First Call consensus was $0.96 a share.
Chubb shares rose 1-5/8, or about three percent, to 54-3/8. Sanford C. Bernstein analyst Weston Hicks said the results were helped by better-than-expected domestic and international premium growth.
"The real surprise, the news in the quarter, was the top-line growth was better than expected," Hicks said.
Analysts said the company's strong underwriting also contributed.

"I have a difficult time figuring out how in an insurance market so bad, a company like Chubb can grow so fast," Lehman analyst Peter Wade said. "I can find no chinks in the armor -- and I'm looking."
Wade said Chubb had an easier time beating forecasts this quarter because analysts had lowered their expectations after being disappointed in the last several quarters.
